channel.title: Whalesbook Financial News
channel.description: Latest Indian and global financial market news

item.title: EPL Ltd: Standalone Profit Surges 187%, Consolidated Dips Amidst CEO Change
item.description: EPL Limited reported a dramatic surge in standalone Net Profit After Tax (PAT) to ₹126.4 Cr, up 187% YoY, fueled by significant other income and exceptional gains. However, consolidated PAT dipped 11.7% YoY to ₹83.1 Cr due to a ₹12 Cr exceptional loss. Revenue showed YoY growth both standalone and consolidated, but consolidated revenue saw a QoQ decline. The company also announced the appointment of Hemani Bakshi as MD & Global CEO, effective January 1, 2026.

item.title: Gen Z, Millennials Dominate Indian Home Buying, Average Age Plummets to 25
item.description: Millennials and Gen Z now comprise 90-95% of Indian homebuyers, pushing the average applicant age down to 25. This demographic shift fuels demand for digital home loan applications, with 72% of younger borrowers preferring online channels. The Indian housing finance market, valued at $329.9 billion, sees robust growth, with public sector banks leading but private lenders and NBFCs gaining significant traction through digital offerings and flexible norms.

item.title: Anuh Pharma Q3: Profit Surges QoQ, But YoY Earnings Dip; USFDA Cleared
item.description: Anuh Pharma reported a robust Q3 FY26 with revenue up 6.08% QoQ to ₹197.18 Cr, and PAT soaring 76.70% QoQ to ₹13.45 Cr, driven by margin expansion. However, for the nine-month period, revenue grew 22.91% YoY to ₹569.54 Cr, while EBITDA and PAT saw declines of 5.66% and 15.85% respectively. The company's USFDA inspection concluded successfully with zero observations. Management guides for 15-16% annual growth and margin improvement.

item.title: Prudential Sugar: Auditor Flags Non-Compliance, Revenue Anomaly; Stock Faces Scrutiny
item.description: Prudential Sugar Corporation's Q3 results are overshadowed by a critical auditor's report flagging non-compliance with IND AS, uncertain balances, and pending litigation. A significant anomaly sees nine-month revenues lower than the third quarter's revenue. While 9M PAT jumped YoY, the auditor notes an 'unascertainable impact' from these issues, raising serious governance and reporting concerns for investors.

item.title: Cubex Tubings Surges to Profitability: Q3 PAT Skyrockets 78% QoQ
item.description: Cubex Tubings Limited announced a significant turnaround, posting a Q3 FY2026 profit of ₹310.31 Cr, a stark contrast to a net loss last year. Revenue edged up 3.1% YoY to ₹7,503 Cr. Profit surged 78% QoQ and EPS jumped to ₹2.17, marking a strong recovery.

item.title: Gautam Gems Profit Plunges 35% Amidst Bizarre Negative Expenses
item.description: Gautam Gems Ltd reported a significant downturn in its Q3 FY26 standalone results. Revenue from operations fell 1.27% year-on-year to ₹1294.55 Lakhs and declined sharply by 43.86% quarter-on-quarter. Net profit after tax saw a steep drop of 35.30% YoY to ₹8.67 Lakhs and 39.46% QoQ. A major point of concern is the recording of 'Other Expenses' as a negative ₹-104.03 Lakhs and 'Changes in inventories' at a negative ₹-140.57 Lakhs for the quarter, figures that warrant close investor scrutiny.

item.title: CSL Finance Posts 25% Profit Growth, But Asset Quality Deteriorates Sharply
item.description: CSL Finance posted a 25% YoY increase in Profit After Tax (PAT) to ₹20.9 Cr for Q3FY26, driven by a 27% YoY rise in Assets Under Management (AUM) to ₹1,460 Cr. However, asset quality showed significant deterioration, with Gross NPA jumping 163% YoY to 1.00% and Net NPA surging 226% YoY to 0.75%. Leverage also increased, with the Debt to Equity Ratio rising to 1.50x.

item.title: Optiemus Q3 Revenue Jumps, Profit Surges, But Auditor Flags Risks
item.description: Optiemus Infracom reported mixed Q3 FY26 results. Standalone revenue jumped 39.7% YoY to ₹202.95 Cr, but pre-tax loss widened. Consolidated net profit surged 1400% YoY to ₹22.29 Cr, though revenue dipped 8.25%. Crucially, auditors flagged inventory valuation issues at Optiemus Electronics and reliance on management financials, alongside ongoing litigation with BlackBerry seeking $22.52 million.

item.title: Aryaman Financial Standalone Surges, But Consolidated Revenue Plummets 95%
item.description: Aryaman Financial Services reported a stark divergence in its Q3 FY26 results. Standalone revenue grew 46.62% YoY to ₹345.40 Cr, with PAT up marginally by 1.50% YoY to ₹75.69 Cr. However, consolidated operations witnessed a dramatic collapse, with revenue plummeting 95.50% YoY to just ₹1.16 Cr and PAT falling 58.96% YoY to ₹8.87 Cr. The company provided no outlook or forward-looking guidance.

item.title: V.S.T. Tillers Tractors Posts Stellar Q3, Drives 44% Revenue Growth
item.description: V.S.T. Tillers Tractors reported a stellar Q3 FY26, with revenue soaring 44% YoY to ₹314 Crores and PAT jumping to ₹30.7 Crores, boosted by a significant margin improvement to 12.9%. Nine-month performance also showed robust growth with turnover up 32% and PAT ₹100.7 Crores. The company saw strong volume surges across power tillers, weeders, and reapers, though tractor exports declined. V.S.T. Tillers is bullish on continuing growth, planning new product launches like electric tillers and expanding its Small Farm Machinery distribution network aggressively.

item.title: AI Champdany Tumbles on Sharp Revenue Drop and Tax Reporting Anomaly
item.description: AI Champdany Industries reported a drastic 83.7% year-on-year decline in Q3 FY26 revenue to ₹4.18 Cr. The company also posted a net loss of ₹1.61 Cr, a sharp deterioration from the previous year. A significant accounting anomaly in tax reporting, where 'Tax expense' figures identically match 'Other Comprehensive Income', raises serious concerns about financial integrity and necessitates urgent clarification from management.

item.title: MTNL Admits Insufficient Funds for Bond Interest Payment
item.description: State-run Mahanagar Telephone Nigam Limited (MTNL) has informed exchanges of its inability to fund the escrow account for an upcoming interest payment on its 7.61% Bond Series VIIIB. Citing "insufficient funds," the company signals severe financial distress and a significant risk of debt default, potentially requiring invocation of India's sovereign guarantee.

item.title: Inox Wind PAT Soars 115% YoY, But Standalone EBITDA Plunges 54%
item.description: Inox Wind reported a strong Q3 FY26 with consolidated revenue up 32.5% YoY to ₹1,207.45 Cr and standalone PAT surging 115.7% YoY to ₹126.33 Cr. However, standalone EBITDA plummeted 54.1% YoY to ₹191.08 Cr, raising concerns over operational profitability. Significant risks include invoked bank guarantees from rejected SPV extensions and auditor observations on revenue recognition and inventory valuation.

item.title: Binayak Tex Sees 275% YoY Profit Surge; QoQ Revenue Slips
item.description: Binayak Tex Processors posted a **275.33% YoY surge** in Q3 FY26 net profit to **₹182.82 Cr**, with total income up **39.74% YoY** to ₹7,257.72 Cr. However, a sharp **QoQ decline** in both revenue (from ₹22,292 Cr) and profit (from ₹278 Cr) raises immediate investor concerns. The company also noted provisions for new labour codes.

item.title: HPL Electric Q3 Revenue Climbs 21% on Smart Meter & C&I Growth
item.description: HPL Electric & Power posted robust Q3 FY2026 results, with revenue climbing 21% YoY to ₹475 Cr and EBITDA soaring 29% to ₹72 Cr. Strong performance in smart metering, bolstered by a ₹3,000 Cr order book, and a rapidly expanding Consumer & Industrial (C&I) business are driving growth. Management targets over 20% topline expansion in FY27 and plans to double the C&I segment revenue by FY27.

item.title: Ola Electric Pivots: Revenue Drops 55% Amid Structural Reset, Margins Jump
item.description: Ola Electric has initiated a "structural reset" for sustainable operations in Q3 FY26, reporting a 55% YoY decline in revenue to ₹470 Cr but achieving a record consolidated gross margin of 34.3%. Operating expenses were cut by 34% YoY. While net losses reduced YoY, they widened QoQ. The company targets ₹15,000-20,000 crore revenue by FY27 and aims for lower operating expenses.

item.title: Akums Drugs Faces IT Probe Amidst Weak Standalone Earnings
item.description: Akums Drugs reported Q3 FY26 results with consolidated revenue up 14.76% YoY, but standalone PAT plunged 31.71%. The company is under an ongoing Income Tax search operation, with its impact currently unascertainable, posing significant investor risk.

item.title: BGR Energy Posts Widening QoQ Loss; Auditors Flag Going Concern Risk
item.description: BGR Energy Systems reported a widening net loss for the quarter ended December 31, 2025, compared to the previous quarter, despite a year-on-year improvement. The company's statutory auditors issued a 'Qualified Conclusion' on its consolidated financial results and flagged a 'Material Uncertainty' regarding its ability to continue as a going concern, citing ongoing debt resolution discussions. Revenue from operations saw a 17.65% YoY increase to ₹77.71 Cr, but expenses surged QoQ, contributing to the loss.

item.title: Cubex Tubings Q3: Profit Surprise Masks ₹767 Cr Reporting Anomaly
item.description: Cubex Tubings Limited reported a turnaround in its Q3 FY26 results with a YoY profit jump, driven by improved revenue and cost control. However, a significant ₹767 crore gap between reported operational profit (showing a loss) and pre-tax profit raises serious questions about financial transparency and reporting accuracy. Investors are urged to examine the unaudited figures closely.

item.title: IFL Enterprises Reports Zero Revenue, Deep Q3 Loss Amidst Red Flags
item.description: IFL Enterprises has reported a drastic financial downturn for the third quarter ended December 31, 2025. Both consolidated and standalone revenue figures plummeted to ₹0.00 Cr, marking a 100% year-on-year and quarter-on-quarter decline. This led to substantial losses before tax for the quarter. While the nine-month period shows a significant YoY increase in profit before tax, this is largely due to an exceptionally low base in the previous year, masking the catastrophic Q3 performance. No forward-looking guidance was provided, amplifying investor concerns.

item.title: RNIT AI Solutions Posts 150% Profit Jump, Raises ₹20 Cr Capital
item.description: RNIT AI Solutions Limited has reported a stellar financial performance for Q3 FY26, with Net Profit soaring 150% year-on-year to ₹3.60 Cr. Revenue from operations also saw robust growth, climbing 72.15% YoY to ₹13.91 Cr. The company also successfully completed a preferential allotment, raising ₹20.83 Cr.

item.title: Varna Industries Q3 Revenue Plummets 95%, Profit Hit Hard
item.description: Varna Industries reported a staggering 94.6% year-over-year drop in Q3 FY26 revenue to ₹3.00 Cr. While sequential growth was seen, with revenue up 65.0% QoQ, the nine-month consolidated results turned into a loss of ₹2.12 Cr. Standalone net profit for Q3 FY26 stood at ₹0.08 Cr, a steep decline from ₹0.83 Cr a year ago.

item.title: TEAM24 Consumer Reports ₹12.25 Cr Net Loss, Negative Q3 Revenue
item.description: TEAM24 Consumer Products Limited (formerly Kore Foods) reported a sharp turnaround to a standalone net loss of ₹12.25 Cr for Q3 FY26, a stark contrast to the breakeven performance in the prior year. Compounding concerns, the company disclosed negative Revenue from Operations (Net) of ₹12.25 Cr for the quarter. The nine-month period also swung to a net loss of ₹2.96 Cr from a profit in FY25. The unusual financial disclosures present significant red flags for investors.

item.title: Acquirers Launch ₹97 Cr Open Offer for Loss-Making Purple Finance
item.description: Allied Commodities Private Limited and Intellect Stock Broking, acting as Persons Acting in Concert, have launched a ₹97.06 crore open offer for Purple Finance Limited. They aim to acquire up to 26% of the equity at ₹55 per share. While the acquirers demonstrate financial strength, Purple Finance has consistently reported substantial net losses despite growing revenues. The acquisition is heavily contingent on obtaining prior approval from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) for the change in control of the NBFC.

item.title: Vama Industries Q3 Revenue Plummets 94.6% YoY, Posts Consolidated Loss
item.description: Vama Industries reported a severe Q3 FY26 performance slump, with YoY revenue dropping 94.6% to ₹3 Cr. Standalone profits fell 90%. The consolidated nine-month period ended December 31, 2025, registered a net loss of ₹2.12 Cr. Despite this stark YoY picture, sequential QoQ results showed a recovery, with standalone revenue up 65.4% and net profit up 45.6%.

item.title: Garbi Finvest Q3 Profit Plummets 87%, Auditor Flags Revenue Issues
item.description: Garbi Finvest Limited announced a steep 87% year-on-year decline in net profit for Q3 FY26, falling to ₹16.35 Lakhs. Revenue from operations decreased by 23.51%. A significant concern for investors is the independent auditor's qualification, which questions the accuracy of revenue recognition due to unrecorded interest on loans.

item.title: Vippy Spinpro Q3 Profit Halved YoY on ₹72 Lakhs Exceptional Hit, Revenue Dips
item.description: Vippy Spinpro reported a steep 51.09% YoY fall in Q3 FY26 net profit to ₹182.97 Lakhs, with revenue down 20.62% to ₹5,549.83 Lakhs. An exceptional item of ₹72.61 Lakhs for past service costs impacted profitability. Despite a 5.05% QoQ revenue rise, net profit declined 33.38% QoQ. The nine-month PAT remained flat YoY. Expansion is ongoing.

item.title: Ola Electric Hits Record 34.3% Gross Margin Amid Cost Cuts
item.description: Ola Electric reported a record 34.3% consolidated gross margin in Q3 FY26, a 15.7 pp YoY jump, driven by a structural operating model reset. Quarterly operating expenses were slashed by 42% to ₹484 Cr from a peak of ₹840 Cr, pushing EBITDA breakeven to just 15,000 units. The company aims to further reduce Opex and scale Gigafactory capacity, positioning for India's electrification boom.

item.title: Inox Wind Q3: Standalone EBITDA Plummets 54%, SPV Investment Risk Looms
item.description: Inox Wind reported a mixed Q3 FY26. Standalone revenue grew 16.55% YoY to ₹1,081.92 Cr and PAT surged 115.65% to ₹126.33 Cr. However, standalone EBITDA plummeted 54.06% YoY to ₹191.08 Cr. Consolidated revenue rose 32.51% to ₹1,207.45 Cr and PAT increased 14.12% to ₹126.65 Cr, with consolidated EBITDA up 8.55%. Significant concerns emerge over ₹55.78 Cr invested in SPVs facing project completion issues and invoked guarantees. No forward guidance was provided.

item.title: Ola Electric Posts 55% Revenue Slump Amid Q3 Restructuring, Margins Improve
item.description: Ola Electric reported a 55% YoY revenue drop to ₹470 Cr in Q3 FY26 as it executed a "structural reset," prioritizing foundations over volume. Gross margins significantly expanded 15.7 pp YoY to 34.3%, but operating EBITDA and PAT deteriorated QoQ despite efforts to cut costs. Deliveries fell 61.1% YoY. The company targets steady-state opex and aims for higher margins by FY27.

item.title: VLS Finance Turns Profitable, Completes ₹100 Cr Share Buyback
item.description: VLS Finance Limited has reported a significant turnaround in its Q3 FY26 results, posting a net profit of ₹1,478.71 Lakhs standalone and ₹1,804.71 Lakhs consolidated, a stark contrast to prior year losses. This surge was primarily driven by substantial gains on fair value changes. The company also successfully completed a ₹100 crore share buyback of 26.3 lakh shares at ₹380 each, impacting EPS calculations.

item.title: Aurum PropTech Faces SEBI Glitch: Funds Misplaced, Timelines Delayed
item.description: Aurum PropTech Limited is under scrutiny as CARE Ratings flagged a deviation from SEBI (ICDR) guidelines. The company invested Rs. 57.56 crore of unutilized rights issue proceeds in debt mutual funds, contrary to regulations. This, coupled with project timeline delays and a four-year history of net losses extending into H1FY26, raises significant governance concerns for investors. The company later moved these funds to scheduled commercial banks.

item.title: Deep Diamond India Funds Deviated; Investor Object Changed, Expenses Overrun
item.description: Deep Diamond India Limited has disclosed significant deviations in the utilization of funds raised via its October 2025 Rights Issue. The company overshot issue expenses by 39.60% and critically, shifted the primary objective from acquiring Oasis Ceramics Private Limited to investing in other companies' securities. Shareholder approval for this change was obtained post-quarter, raising transparency concerns for investors.

item.title: Banks Pocket ₹4,818 Cr from Minimum Balance Penalties Amidst Lok Sabha Criticism
item.description: Indian banks raked in ₹4,818 crore in penalties from customers failing to maintain minimum average balances in FY25. A Lok Sabha committee report highlighted these charges, particularly criticizing private lenders like HDFC Bank, Axis Bank, and ICICI Bank for disproportionately high fees that strain low-income account holders. The panel urged banks to adopt fairer alternatives, suggesting interest on shortfalls rather than hefty fines.

item.title: SBI Posts Record Quarterly Profit, Surges 24.5% YoY on Strong Growth
item.description: State Bank of India (SBI) reported its highest-ever quarterly net profit of ₹21,028 crore for Q3 FY26, a substantial 24.49% year-on-year increase. Total business crossed ₹103 trillion, with operating profit up 39.54%. The bank revised its credit growth guidance upwards to 13-15% for the current quarter and maintained its long-term ROA and NIM targets. Asset quality showed improvement with lower NPAs, and a strong capital adequacy ratio. Digital transformation via YONO and expansion in green financing are key strategic pillars.

item.title: Ola Electric Revenue Plummets 57%, Faces Going Concern Scrutiny
item.description: Ola Electric's consolidated revenue plunged 57% year-over-year to ₹504 Cr for Q3 FY26, with net loss at ₹487 Cr. The consolidated entity reported negative operating cash flow of ₹866 Cr for the nine months ended December 31, 2025, prompting management to assess its going concern assumption. Despite unutilized IPO funds of ₹1,503 Cr, these results signal significant financial pressures.

item.title: Park Medi World IPO Funds: ₹2,371 Cr Spent on Acquisitions & Debt Repayment
item.description: Park Medi World Limited has utilized ₹2,371.70 million of its IPO proceeds in Q3 FY26, primarily for subsidiary debt repayment and strategic inorganic acquisitions, including KPIMS and Krishna Super-speciality Hospital. CRISIL Ratings confirms no deviation from IPO objects. A substantial ₹5,328.30 million remains unutilized for future capital expenditure, debt reduction, and further acquisitions.

item.title: RNIT AI Solutions Surges 72% Revenue, Profit Soars 150%
item.description: RNIT AI Solutions, formerly Autopal Industries, reported robust Q3 FY26 results, with revenue leaping 72.25% YoY to ₹13.91 Cr and net profit surging 149.99% to ₹3.60 Cr. The company, now focused on AI solutions, also completed a preferential allotment of ₹20.83 Cr from strategic investors, signalling confidence in its new direction. Nine-month figures show similar strong growth.

item.title: Lasa Supergenerics Reels From Fire, Faces Production Halt & Going Concern Doubt
item.description: Lasa Supergenerics has reported significant operational disruption following a fire incident on May 18, 2025. The company detailed substantial uninsured losses, including ₹1,273.62 Lakhs in inventory and ₹700.00 Lakhs in property, plant & equipment. Production has completely halted across all units, with management exploring contract manufacturing amid statutory clearance delays. Auditors raised concerns over dormant bank accounts and suspended revenue recognition due to force majeure, casting doubt on the company's ability to continue as a going concern.

item.title: TruAlt Bioenergy Surges 70% Revenue QoQ, Eyes CBG & SAF Growth
item.description: TruAlt Bioenergy reported a strong 70% quarter-on-quarter revenue surge to ₹730.86 Cr in Q3 FY26, driven by multi-grain operations and plant commissioning. However, Profit After Tax (PAT) declined 7.98% YoY to ₹69.19 Cr, impacted by plant downtime and increased depreciation. The company outlined aggressive expansion plans, including 24 CBG units, a SAF facility, and scaling its retail network to 75 outlets.
